explanation.overview: 这两个动词都表示'预期'或'预料'，但在使用场景和含义侧重上有所不同。

details.meaning: 基于合理依据认为某事会发生，含有较强确定性
details.example: I expect the package to arrive tomorrow.（我预计包裹明天会到。）

details.meaning: 不仅预料某事会发生，还常包含提前准备或期待的意思
details.example: We anticipated the traffic jam and left early.（我们预料到会堵车，所以提前出发了。）

life_examples.expect: The boss expects the report by Friday.（老板预期周五前收到报告。）
life_examples.anticipate: We anticipated market changes and adjusted our strategy.（我们预见到市场变化并调整了策略。）

life_examples.expect: Do you expect many guests for the party?（你预计会有很多客人来参加派对吗？）
life_examples.anticipate: She anticipated the rain and brought an umbrella.（她预料到会下雨所以带了伞。）

common_errors.error: ❌ I anticipate you to finish on time.
common_errors.correction: ✅ I expect you to finish on time.（对他人的明确期望用expect）

common_errors.error: ❌ They expected problems and prepared solutions.
common_errors.correction: ✅ They anticipated problems and prepared solutions.（预料并准备用anticipate更准确）

mini_test.question: 选择最合适的词：___ a large crowd at the concert.
哪个词暗示了提前准备？
填空：The team ___ winning the championship this year.

special_cases.grammar_difference: expect可接不定式(to do)，anticipate接动名词(doing)
special_cases.legal_context: expectation在法律中有特殊含义（合理期待原则）
